intro: Hariota ramulosa, commonly known as the hairy harita, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. Hariota ramulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
